Operational Protocol Rationale: The vessel is navigating a gently curving coastal or inland waterway route with stable speed and minimal heading variation, consistent with standard transit procedures in constrained maritime environments. Its steady propulsion, smooth course adjustment, and alignment between direction of travel and heading indicate controlled, predictable movement along a predefined path—typical for cargo vessels operating under normal conditions in such areas. Although the exact shipping lane data is unavailable, the observed behavior matches expected patterns for vessels following curved routes where slight trajectory adjustments are made over time. This rules out abrupt maneuvers or loitering, and contrasts with straight-route behaviors seen in open-water transit.
